The upper class, also known as the aristocracy or the elite, is typically defined as the wealthiest and most powerful segment of society. They hold the majority of the wealth and power, and their influence extends beyond the economic sphere to the political, social, and cultural realms as well.

The upper class has a unique advantage when it comes to leadership roles.
